intro: Caucalis tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf caucalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, aromatic seeds that are dispersed by wind. Caucalis tenuifolia is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
